content.p: Pick a student at random. Let B denote the event that the student ate breakfast this morning; let M denote the event that the student is male.

body.p: One of the following choices is larger than the other two. Which is it?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The last comment tells us that: "B or M" is a more general event than "B" and therefore has a larger probability. "B and M" is a more specific event than "B" and therefore has a smaller probability.
